basics.name: Noah Burnette
basics.label: I make software for the manufacturing industry
basics.summary: I am a software engineer that helps digitally transforms manufacturing across the world.

work.name: Intellic Integration
highlights: Developed versioned test-driven MES applications using Ignition.
Created a Unified Development Environment using containerization, improving developer experience.
Gained experience in various fields, including food and beverage and battery manufacturing.
Assisted in the development of a native test engine for Ignition, streamlining testing processes.

work.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co.
highlights: Employed T-SQL to design stored procedures and views for streamlined database operations.
Implemented back-end functionality using Python, enhancing the performance of server-side calls.
Led the adoption of Agile practices using Azure DevOps.
work.location: Mills River, North Carolina, United States

work.name: Microtech Knives
highlights: Created Docker images to facilitate seamless deployment of workspaces.
Conducted network analysis, uncovering potential security threats.
Installed and configured Meraki hardware, enhancing network robustness.

projects.name: GoMES
projects.description: Implementation of MES within a ISA95 context. Designed to be reusable and configurable.
highlights: Developed a modular event driven manufacturing execution system using Go
Automated DAO and model creation using Gorm, decoupling the database from the application.
Used Docker to containerize the application, streamlining deployment and scaling.
Created documented RESTful API using Gin and Swag, simplifying integration with other systems.
Implemented Edge capabilties using MQTT and OPC-UA, enabling near real-time data collection and analysis.

projects.name: Pyile
projects.description: Modular Python application enabling secure and private messaging via P2P.
highlights: Created Pyile protocol supporting authentication and messaging, ensuring data privacy.
Implemented robust security measures to protect user communications and integrity.
